article:
In baseball statistics, 'games pitched' (denoted by 'GP', or Games'G' in tables
of only pitching statistics) is the number of games in which a player appears as
a pitcher; a player who is announced as the pitcher must face at least one
batter, although exceptions are made if the pitcher announced in the starting
lineup is injured before facing a batter, perhaps while batting or running the
bases in the top of the first inning, before the opposing team comes to bat. The
statistic is also referred to as 'appearances', usually to refer to the number
of games a relief pitcher has pitched in.
